csc171.project03.sprites

Class AbstractSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • csc171.project03.sprites.AbstractSprite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Asteroid, Bomb, Missile, Spaceship

    public abstract class AbstractSprite
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines some default behavior for a sprite that is then inherited in to some specific children. Good use of package private in the fields here.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSprite

        public AbstractSprite(double collisionRadius,
                      Movement rotation,
                      Movement angularVelocity,
                      Movement angularAcceleration,
                      Movement position,
                      Movement linearVelocity,
                      Movement linearAcceleration)
        Creates a new Sprite.
        Parameters:
        collisionRadius - the collision radius.
        rotation - the inital angular position.
        angularVelocity - the initial angular velocity.
        angularAcceleration - the initial angular acceleration.
        position - the initial rectilinear position.
        linearVelocity - the initial rectilinear velocity.
        linearAcceleration - the initial rectilinear acceleration.

    • Method Detail

      • getAge

        public long getAge()
        Returns:
        the age of the Sprite, in millis.

      • updateMovements

        public void updateMovements(long timeStep)
        Updates all of the Movement fields of the Sprite.
        Parameters:
        timeStep - the timeStep to update the Movements over.

      • dampMovements

        public void dampMovements()
        Retards the Movements. By damping, the Movements are all limited at some maximum rate. Also brings the Sprite to rest when it's not actively being driven.

      • setAngularAcceleration

        public void setAngularAcceleration(Movement angularAcceleration)
        Sets the angular acceleration of the Sprite.
        Parameters:
        angularAcceleration - the Movement to set.

      • increaseAcceleration

        public void increaseAcceleration()
        Increases the linear acceleration of the Sprite by a constant amount.

      • setLinearAcceleration

        public void setLinearAcceleration(Movement linearAcceleration)
        Sets the linear acceleration of the Sprite.
        Parameters:
        linearAcceleration - the Movement to set.

      • rotateRight

        public void rotateRight()
        Increases the angular acceleration of the Sprite in the clockwise direction by a constant amount.

      • rotateLeft

        public void rotateLeft()
        Increases the angular acceleration of the Sprite in the counterclockwise direction by a constant amount.

      • isInbounds

        public boolean isInbounds(java.awt.Dimension canvasDimensions)
        Checks if the Sprite is within the passed Dimensions.
        Parameters:
        canvasDimensions - the Dimensions to check
        Returns:
        whether the Sprite is within the Dimensions

      • wrap

        public void wrap(java.awt.Dimension canvasDimensions)
        If this Sprite is out of the bounds of the passed Dimension, teleports the Sprite to the other side of the canvas (left to/from right and top to/from bottom).
        Parameters:
        canvasDimensions - the Dimensions to wrap around.

      • isCollidedWith

        public boolean isCollidedWith(AbstractSprite sprite)
        Returns if this Sprite has collided with the passed Sprite.
        Parameters:
        sprite - is the Sprite to check collision with.
        Returns:
        whether the Sprites have collided.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Calls the child Sprite's #drawSprite() method.
        Parameters:
        g - is the Graphics to paint with.

      • drawSprite

        abstract void drawSprite(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws this Sprite.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics to paint with.

      • destroy

        public AbstractSprite[] destroy()
        Calls the child Sprite's #destroySprite() method.
        Returns:
        an array of child AbstractSprites

      • destroySprite

        abstract AbstractSprite[] destroySprite()
        Destroys this Sprite. Returns 0 to n Sprites that result from this one being destroyed.
        Returns:
        an array of child AbstractSprites
